metadata.title: Internet Explorer Memory Corruption Vulnerability – CVE-2015-6066 (MS15-112)
metadata.description: Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 through 11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted web site, aka "Internet Explorer Memory Corruption Vulnerability," a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-6070, CVE-2015-6071, CVE-2015-6074, CVE-2015-6076, and CVE-2015-6087.

criteria.comment: Check for installation of vulnerable IE + vulnerable Windows OS + vulnerable file version
IE7 is installed + Windows OS + file version
Microsoft Windows Vista/Server 2008 is installed

extend_definition.comment: Microsoft Windows Vista x64 Edition is installed

criteria.comment: Check for file version

criterion.comment: Check if mshtml.dll version is less than 7.0.6002.19520

criteria.comment: Check for Limited Distribution Release (LDR) file version

criterion.comment: Check if mshtml.dll version is greater than or equal to 7.0.6002.23000
Check if mshtml.dll version is less than 7.0.6002.23830
